title: F2: Curve fitting and statistical analysis
description: Fit mathematical models to ESP data. Models: simple exponential, piecewise exponential, Wright's Law, logistic curves. Output: parameter estimates, doubling times, extrapolations to ESP=1. Software: Python scipy/statsmodels.

title: B1: Domestication timeline compilation
description: Compile domestication timelines, population sizes, trait fixation times for key species (wheat/maize, dogs, cattle). Sources: archaeological/genetic literature, zooarchaeology, ancient DNA studies.

title: G2: Methods drafting
description: Draft methods section (~1000 words): data sources and extraction, standardization procedures, curve fitting methodology, sensitivity analysis approach.

title: D1: Directed evolution data compilation
description: Compile library sizes screened, rounds of selection, hit rates by method from Arnold lab publications and directed evolution reviews. Include historical data and ML-guided design outcomes.

title: C3: Speed breeding literature review
description: Review speed breeding protocols and efficiency gains. Sources: Watson et al., Hickey et al. Quantify cycle time reductions and impact on ESP.

title: E4: Gene therapy/CAR-T data
description: Compile gene therapy and CAR-T outcomes. Include Kymriah, Yescarta complete response rates, Zolgensma, Luxturna efficacy. Expected ESP range: 1-5.

title: D3: CRISPR efficiency data
description: Compile CRISPR edit success rates by organism, off-target rates over time, time from design to validated edit from methodology literature.

title: E2: FDA approval package analysis
description: Analyze FDA drug approval packages for pivotal trial sample sizes over time, response rates by therapeutic area. Track evolution of trial sizes and NNT values.

title: C2: CGIAR/CIMMYT historical analysis
description: Analyze historical CGIAR/CIMMYT breeding records. Calculate ESP_breeding = (Crosses × Progeny × Selection cycles) / Released varieties. Reference: Evenson & Gollin 2003, Duvick 2005.

title: F3: Visualization development
description: Create figures: ESP framework diagram, ESP vs time for each domain, unified curve overlay, doubling time analysis, projection to ESP=1. Target: 8 main figures per paper outline.

title: A1: Evolution literature review
description: Compile quantitative data on mutation rates, population sizes, and phenotypic innovation rates in natural evolution. Deliverables: annotated bibliography (20-30 papers), data table with taxon/mutation rate/population size/generation time/innovations, summary of major transitions framework.

title: G3: Results drafting
description: Draft results section (~3000 words): Results by domain (evolution, domestication, breeding, biotech, clinical), unified curve construction.

title: C1: Breeding program data acquisition
description: Acquire breeding program records from CGIAR archives, university programs, USDA. Target programs: CIMMYT wheat/maize, US soybean breeding, dairy cattle genetic improvement. Collect crosses, selections, outcomes, variety release timelines.

title: G1: Introduction drafting
description: Draft introduction (~1000 words): Moore's Law of biology quest, why previous attempts failed, search efficiency insight, ESP framework overview.

title: G4: Discussion drafting
description: Draft discussion (~1500 words): biotech investment implications, clinical trial design implications, N=1 horizon, limitations, future directions.

title: E3: Precision medicine trial outcomes
description: Compile response rates for biomarker-stratified treatments. Key trials: IMPACT, NCI-MATCH, TAPUR, basket/umbrella trials. Track biomarker-drug pairs: HER2/trastuzumab, EGFR/gefitinib, ALK/crizotinib, BRAF/vemurafenib, BCR-ABL/imatinib, PD-L1/checkpoint inhibitors.

title: B2: Archaeological crop/animal data
description: Extract detailed archaeological data on crop yields, animal trait changes during domestication. Calculate ESP_domestication values. Expected ESP range: 10^6 - 10^10.

title: E1: Historical NNT database construction
description: Build comprehensive database of Number Needed to Treat values across therapeutic areas and time periods. Sources: TheNNT.com, Cochrane reviews, Bandolier, FDA packages. Priority areas: cardiovascular, infectious disease, oncology, diabetes, neurological.

title: F1: Phenotype complexity scoring system
description: Develop Phenotypic Complexity Score (PCS) normalization. Levels 1-7: single trait shift (1) to major transition (64). Alternative: information-theoretic PCS = log₂(distinguishable phenotypic states).

title: A2: Major transitions data extraction
description: Extract quantitative data on major evolutionary transitions using Maynard Smith & Szathmáry framework. Calculate ESP for major phenotypic innovations. Expected ESP range: 10^15 - 10^20.

title: D2: ML-guided protein design outcomes
description: Compile ML-guided protein design success rates (2020-present). Track ESP trajectory: Classic DE 10^5-10^8, Structure-guided 10^3-10^5, ML-guided 10^1-10^3, Frontier ML 10^0-10^1.
